00073 inline double DMath::degreesToRadians(const double d){
00074   return d * (M_PI / 180.);
00075 }
00076 
00078 inline double DMath::radiansToDegrees(const double r){
00079   return r * (180./M_PI);
00080 }

00098 inline double DMath::variance(double *rgVals, int len){
00099   double sumX = 0.;
00100   double sumX2 = 0.;
00101 
00102   if(0 == len)
00103     return 0.;
00104   for(int i = 0; i < len; ++i){
00105     register double val;
00106     val = rgVals[i];
00107     sumX += val;
00108     sumX2 += (val * val);
00109   }
00110   return (sumX2 - sumX*sumX/len)/len;
00111 }
00112 
00114 inline double DMath::variance(int *rgVals, int len){
00115   double sumX = 0.;
00116   double sumX2 = 0.;
00117 
00118   if(0 == len)
00119     return 0.;
00120   for(int i = 0; i < len; ++i){
00121     register double val;
00122     val = (double)(rgVals[i]);
00123     sumX += val;
00124     sumX2 += (val * val);
00125   }
00126   return (sumX2 - sumX*sumX/len)/len;
00127 }

00132 inline double DMath::distPointLine(double x, double y, double x0, double y0,
00133            double x1, double y1){
00134   register double x1mx0, y1my0;
00135   //The method used to calculate this is described at the following URLs:
00136   //http://www.allegro.cc/forums/thread/589720
00137   //http://www.softsurfer.com/Archive/algorithm_0102/algorithm_0102.htm
00138   //(the two equations are equivalent, as seen through algebraic manipulation)
00139   x1mx0 = x1-x0;
00140   y1my0 = y1-y0;
00141   return fabs((x-x0)*y1my0-x1mx0*(y-y0)) / sqrt(x1mx0*x1mx0+y1my0*y1my0);
00142   //The directed distance could be calculated by using the signed value in the
00143   // numberator instead of taking the absolute value (the sign of the result
00144   // would indicate which side of the line the point is on)
00145 
00146 }
00147 
00149 
00154 inline double DMath::distPointLineSegment3D(double x, double y, double z,
00155               double x0, double y0, double z0,
00156               double x1, double y1, double z1){
00157   double dblU;
00158 
00159   
00160   if( (x0 == x1) && (y0 == y1) && (z0 == z1)){
00161     // the segment is really a point.  just return dist to point
00162     return sqrt( (x-x0)*(x-x0) + (y-y0)*(y-y0) + (z-z0)*(z-z0));
00163   }
00164 
00165   dblU = ( (x-x0)*(x1-x0) + (y-y0)*(y1-y0) + (z-z0)*(z1-z0) ) /
00166     ( (x1-x0)*(x1-x0) + (y1-y0)*(y1-y0) + (z1-z0)*(z1-z0) );
00167 
00168   if(dblU < 0.){
00169 #if 1
00170     if( sqrt( (x-x1)*(x-x1) + (y-y1)*(y-y1) + (z-z1)*(z-z1)) <
00171   sqrt( (x-x0)*(x-x0) + (y-y0)*(y-y0) + (z-z0)*(z-z0)) ){
00172       fprintf(stderr, "DMath::distPointLineSegment3D() logic error (1)!\n");
00173       abort();
00174     }
00175 #endif
00176     return sqrt( (x-x0)*(x-x0) + (y-y0)*(y-y0) + (z-z0)*(z-z0));
00177   }
00178   else if(dblU > 1.){
00179 #if 1
00180     if( sqrt( (x-x0)*(x-x0) + (y-y0)*(y-y0) + (z-z0)*(z-z0)) <
00181   sqrt( (x-x1)*(x-x1) + (y-y1)*(y-y1) + (z-z1)*(z-z1)) ){
00182       fprintf(stderr, "DMath::distPointLineSegment3D() logic error! (2)\n");
00183       abort();
00184     }
00185 #endif
00186     return sqrt( (x-x1)*(x-x1) + (y-y1)*(y-y1) + (z-z1)*(z-z1));
00187   }
00188   else{
00189     double xp, yp, zp;
00190     xp = x0 + dblU * (x1-x0);
00191     yp = y0 + dblU * (y1-y0);
00192     zp = z0 + dblU * (z1-z0);
00193 
00194     return sqrt( (x-xp)*(x-xp) + (y-yp)*(y-yp) + (z-zp)*(z-zp) );
00195   }
00196 
00197 
00198   return 0.;
00199 }

00202 
00205 inline double DMath::whichSideOfLine(double x, double y,
00206              double x0, double y0, double x1,double y1){
00207   return (x1-x0)*(y-y0)-(y1-y0)*(x-x0);
00208 }

00210 
00212 //I changed the parameter types from float to double and the return type
00213 //(as well as type of variable "c") from int to bool, and the name of the
00214 //point variables from testx, testy to x, y.  -djk
00215 inline bool DMath::pnpoly(int nvert, double *vertx, double *verty,
00216         double x, double y){
00217   int i, j;
00218   bool c = false;
00219   for (i = 0, j = nvert-1; i < nvert; j = i++) {
00220     if ( ((verty[i]>y) != (verty[j]>y)) &&
00221    (x < (vertx[j]-vertx[i]) * (y-verty[i]) / (verty[j]-verty[i]) + vertx[i]) )
00222        c = !c;
00223   }
00224   return c;
00225 }
00226 
00227 
00229 inline bool DMath::getBarycentricCoords(double *L1, double *L2, double *L3,
00230           double x, double y,
00231           double Ax, double Ay,
00232           double Bx, double By,
00233           double Cx, double Cy){
00234   double denom;
00235   denom = (By-Cy)*(Ax-Cx)+(Cx-Bx)*(Ay-Cy);
00236   if(denom==0.)
00237     denom = 0.00000001;
00238   (*L1) = (By-Cy)*(x-Cx)+(Cx-Bx)*(y-Cy)/denom;
00239   denom = (Cy-Ay)*(x-Cx)+(Ax-Cx)*(y-Cy);
00240   if(denom==0.)
00241     denom = 0.00000001;
00242   (*L2) = (Cy-Ay)*(Bx-Cx)+(Ax-Cx)*(By-Cy)/denom;
00243   (*L3) = 1. - (*L1) - (*L2);
00244   return true;
00245 }
00246 
00247 inline bool DMath::getCoordsFromBarycentric(double *x, double *y,
00248               double L1, double L2, double L3,
00249               double Ax, double Ay,
00250               double Bx, double By,
00251               double Cx, double Cy){
00252   (*x) = L1*Ax+L2*Bx+L3*Cx;
00253   (*y) = L1*Ay+L2*By+L3*Cy;
00254   return true;
00255 }
